dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see an aerial shot of Boston. The sound of WAAB-FM bur over the top. We hear about local events, rock concerts, films. We see a red 75’ Chevy Van stuck in traffic. Title: May 13 1978. Boston.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. STREET. ABANDONED FACTORY. DAY
dialogues.text: A blue 72 Plymouth Fury is parked up by a battered lookin warehouse. There are three people inside. A woman and a m in the front, a man in the back. INT. PLYMOUTH DAY. In the drivers seat: Justine. 28. Big polarized Sunglasse Suit. Small build, blonde hair. By her side: Frank. 50. Leather jacket. Smoking. Slacks. Dark hair flecked with g Stocky. In the back seat: Chris. 35. Green combat Jacket. Raybans. Dark hair. Slim. Frank looks straight ahead angrily. When he speaks it’s i Belfast accent.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Where is he? Justine speaks; flat American with a tinge of something European.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTINE
dialogues.text: It’s okay Frank. We have ten minutes yet. Frank shakes his head and looks at his watch. Chris shrug He speaks with a Dublin accent.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: These things happen, probably traffic. Frank sniffs. This is on him. He brought the late guy int this.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Fuck it. I hate this shit.

dialogues.text: Stop fretting... it’s fine. Justine smiles listening to the conversation.

dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Long time... The sex has stopped. We just argue now.

dialogues.text: You flatter yourself. I wouldn’t go gay for you...

dialogues.text: Who then?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: No one... I don’t want to talk about that kind of thing.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: You started it... Chris enjoys needling Frank.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK CHRIS
dialogues.text: I knew his Father Here it comes.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I promised i'd keep him out of trouble.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Well you pretty much fucked that up.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Ah well, life can get in the way of promises sometimes. Justine smiles. She knows.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Justine? Justine is looking out the window, lost in her own though After a beat she turns.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTINE
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: Originally?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: German. Looks she’s smiling. Justine smiles to herself.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Laughing... at you.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: When I say German... She smiles. It’s the memory of the old country... the Motherland... Germany, Germany, Germany...

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: I spent six weeks in Stockholm in 72 remember.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: That thing... Fuck. How could I forget that. Frank shakes his head remembering.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTINE
dialogues.text: I'm Swedish Chris smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: You see.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Don’t overplay your hand.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: I'd like to go back to Stockholm.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Well that can happen soon enough. We just have to sort this bit of business out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then back we go

dialogues.speaker: JUSTINE
dialogues.text: Boston?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: America. There’s a pause. It’s as if she’s never considered it.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTINE
dialogues.text: Sure. She isn’t giving anything away from behind her sunglasses Frank smiles and lights up. He wants to go home. He watch stray dog nosing around in some rubbish.

dialogues.speaker: INT. RED CHEVY DAY
dialogues.text: Inside, Stevo, 28. Long hair, wide ‘Apocalypse Now’ moustache. T-shirt jacket and jeans. He has a black eye. talks in a Boston accent. Bernie is his heavy lidded side kick. Bernie is driving, Stevo is holding his head in his hands

dialogues.text: My fucking head.

dialogues.text: Every time... I tell you

dialogues.speaker: STEVO

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: I am driving... Stevo decants a little of the Heroin into a burnt bit of foil.

dialogues.text: Dont worry man.. SNIFFFF... What can go wrong? He passes back the wrap. Bernie smiles and Stevo drifts on a warm cloud of morphia EXT. STREET. The van pulls up behind the Plymouth. Stevo gets out. Fra has already got out to meet him. He walks over to the man drags him back to the van. We cut in close now and see:

dialogues.speaker: FRANK

dialogues.speaker: STEVO

dialogues.text: That’s nice.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You doing us a Sligo reduction then?

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: We're doing our bit. I don’t need to be here at all. Frank sucks his teeth. He knows what doing your bit entai And it’s cost him a lot more than Martin would ever be prepared to give up. Chris smells the gun. He looks down the barrel.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: You got some rounds?

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: Sure. Vernon rolls the bullets along the table top. Chris takes rounds and pops them in the magazine.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: I’m going to slowly take out my handgun. Is that okay Frank? Frank looks at Chris. Chris nods. Its okay.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Sure. Okay. Ord takes out his pistol and aims it at the ground.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: This is just a precaution. While the rifle is live.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: You worked with these guys before Ord?

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Sure

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It’s okay to fire?

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: Fire away. No one can hear us.  21.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Hey Ord. You ever used your military background to chat up women?

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Try not to hit any metalwork. I don’t want to get tagged by a ricochet. Chris gives him a slow sad look. He shoulders the rifle a takes aim.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Military background? Chris looks over at Justine.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Your memories of war... the band of brothers... Blah blah.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: No... Who would want to hear that shit? The others step away and put their fingers in their ears.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: You more the silent type Ord? Chris squeezes off a round as Ord is about to answer.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry what? Ord goes to talk again.

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: I hear its all about eye contact

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry - what?

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: It’s about eye contact. And caring words. Chris looks at Justine, who is giggling slightly. Chris m a ‘maybe he has a point’ face. Then pulls the trigger. It makes a huge noise in the space. In the distance there a thwack as the bullet hits home. The ejected cartridge h the floor and rolls about. Chris looks back at the others. Then to Frank.  22.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Okay. Chris squeezes of a few more shots. Refuse bags pop. A lo falls over. There’s a clanging echo in the Warehouse. The echo of the shots dims. Chris then adjusts the Rifle to full auto. He lets off a burst. He then puts on the safety. Takes out the magazine and pu the rack, ejecting a live round. He does this twice more presents it to Vernon. Vernon nods when he sees it’s safe. Chris puts the rifle back on the table. Ord holsters his pistol. Chris takes out a pen and uses it to pick up the brass. He puts them on the table. He looks up at the pill near the table. He walks over to it. Ord watches him.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I thought we had talked about M16‘s?

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: We did.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: The Brits wont even use these things. They fail in the mud. Chris runs his hands over the pillar. There are pock mark it. He looks at Ord. (What Chris is looking at are fresh bullet scars. This place has recently been used as a firi range.)

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: Well don’t roll about in the mud...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ord watches Chris looking at Pillar

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: What is the matter?

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: What does that look like to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank frowns and starts negotiating. Justine watches Chri  23.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I’ve got money for M16’s

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: Well I’ve got AR-18’s - that’s it. Ord looks at the marks

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Bullet hits? He shrugs. Not understanding why it might be relevant. Chris looks out to the edges of the warehouse. They would have come from a ways off. Chris looks to Ord then gives on his investigation. He turns to Vernon.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: How many?

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: They all folding stock?

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: Sure

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Well where are they?

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Lets see the money chief. Chris pops the case on the table. He opens it up. Martin into his bag and pulls out a money counter. Inside we see 20 round mag for the AR18. He feeds the money into the counter. Justine looks at the money for a moment. They all stand around and stare as he does it.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: It’s not that we don’t trust you... it’s just easier this way.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Sure. The money flips through the counter. It comes to an end. Martin looks up.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: What would you do if you won the lottery?

dialogues.speaker: JUSTINE
dialogues.text: I'd buy a cabin back home.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: What’s the matter with here?

dialogues.speaker: JUSTINE
dialogues.text: I like it here, but, it’s just moving through y’know.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: Not really...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: So you going to do us a reduction on these non M16's?

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: I’1l do them at 10% off.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: 12 Chris nods.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Okay. So I take $1200 back?

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: Sure. I can do you that in ammo if you want.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You were going to charge extra on the ammo?

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: It’s specialist. You got a press you can do it in your garage or what not? Frank shrugs defeated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the van sits Gordon: 32. Shoulder length hair. Lea jacket. Harry: 27. Baby faced. Bomber jacket. Harry is picking his knuckles. They are grazed from fighting. Gord watches out of the corner of his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got the walky turned on?

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Yeah, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: We've been here ages. Maybe something has gone wrong.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Sure. They would have squawked. signal.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: How long have you worked for Vernon?

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Long enough. Your energy is very jumpy. Can you ratchet it down a couple of notches.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Sure. I’m just ready I guess...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: To load some boxes?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No... just peeeewwwwww ready. Gordon rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: You need to wash those knuckles you will get an infection.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I was in a fight. The walky squawks.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: That’s the sign. 25. The or Gordan starts up the van. John Denver starts up on the 8 track.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You like John Denver?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Sure  26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance there is the noise of a van starting up. men stand patiently as it approaches. Frank is tense. He looks over to Chris. Chris is not scared but looks on intensely. He strokes his jacket where his gun is. Frank looks to Martin. The van enters the warehouse.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Look, if we wanted to rip you off it would have happened already. Frank looks them up and down for a second. He’s like a ca with a mouse.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: How do you all know each other?

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Will it make the guns fire any straighter if you knew? Vernon points at Justine.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: She vouches for us. That’s how it works. Justine smiles. Thats right.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t want to know you Frank. I’ve got enough friends already. You Don’t want to know me. She brings us all together. Its safer that way. Franks face is set. He’s smiling but he’s not happy. Just detects this. Martins is resolute in not talking.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTINE
dialogues.text: My father had a gun shop in Sweden. I’ve known the Corsican since I was kid. They know the Corsican, so we are all friends.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: That's cozy. You always been into guns Justine?

dialogues.speaker: JUSTINE
dialogues.text: I grew up with them. How about you?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: My Father took me shooting when I was a boy. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’ve always been around them. He was a good shot. Later he was in the Easter uprising. It was a good skill to have.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Story time over?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What war were you in Ord?

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Whatever it was, the great Irish army wasn’t involved...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van rolls in. It comes to a stop. The two men get out They walk around the back of the truck and start unloadin One of the men looks at Stevo. He walks around the van. Martin opens the back door with a key on his key chain. T two men (Gordon and Harry) Start lugging out the boxes. T are about 0.5 ft by 3ft wooden containers with rope handl Martin takes the van keys from Harry and pockets them. Soon there is a pile of boxes. Gordon and Harry are sweat slightly. Harry is eyeing Stevo.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Lets have a look then. Vernon takes a crowbar and opens one of the boxes. Inside three AR18’s in wood chippings. Frank smiles. He points t random box.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: What’s your daughter called?

dialogues.speaker: JUSTINE
dialogues.text: Agneth.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: How about that one... Vernon shrugs and opens it. Same deal.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Just open em all. The boxes are opened up. Inside sit the AR18’s Frank purs his lips. Chris leans into Justine. Martin watches neutra

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can’t believe you wont see me tomorrow.  28.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTINE
dialogues.text: Do you think I’m stupid?

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JUSTINE
dialogues.text: Stop pretending to be interested in my kid.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Just making conversation... Chris looks at the guns. Vernon looks over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: They like to run wet. Keep it lubed even when its dirty. He pulls out a can of lube.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: On the house... Chris plays with the folding stock.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: You got the ammo?

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: Sure. In the back... But not yet. Chris smiles. Everyone is cautious. Harry takes another look at Stevo as he passes with a box Stevo looks at him with vague recognition. This look turn cold dread over the next few moments. Gordon and Harry br the last box out and put it down. Round the other side of the van Stevo motions to Bernie.

dialogues.speaker: STEVO
dialogues.text: Look who it is... Bernie looks back over his shoulder and spots Harry.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: Oh fuck no. Has he made you?

dialogues.speaker: STEVO
dialogues.text: How could he not? Frank makes an inventory of the contents of the boxes. He counts the contents and Chris has a look at a random samp They are all the same - this is the real deal. All new. H is sneaking peaks at Stevo here and there. As each box is signed off, it’s resealed and stacked.  29. A two foot high wooden wall is being built out of packing cases. Gordon looks and sees Harry looking agitated. Round the back of the van he talks to Harry

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: What’s the matter with you?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I think I know those guys.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Cops?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No.. From last night..

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: You better get your shit together because we are in a serious situation here... Just chill out. Around the front of the van the deal is coming to a close

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Okay. That’s our business almost done here.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: You tell the Corsican thanks.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Perfecto. We will leave and then you load out. Give us 5 minutes. You can drive your vehicle round on Lassiter.

dialogues.speaker: STEVO
dialogues.text: Okay. Got it. Harry is staring now. Staring at Stevo. Gordon looks from Harry to Vernon.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Harry...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I know you.

dialogues.speaker: STEVO
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Shut up Harry.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: What’s the problem Gordon?  30. Martin looks at his watch and glances to Justine. She tak small step back. His watch is ticking towards 12.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: STEVO
dialogues.text: No you don’t.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah I do. Martin takes a small look to the far pillars.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: What’s this about Harry?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: This is the guy that hit us last night at Harlequins. Him and his buddy there. Bernie shifts uncomfortably. There is a pause. Frank looks up. Chris looks carefully a Harry.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: Is this true?

dialogues.speaker: STEVO
dialogues.text: I don’t know what you are talking about. A moment passes. Vernon stares at Stevo.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: You are a terrible liar son.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Come on now. Don’t be calling my brother in-law a liar Stevo is starting to sweat. He looks to Frank. Bernie loo into the middle distance trying to disappear.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell them Steven.

dialogues.speaker: STEVO
dialogues.text: I don’t know what he’s talking about. Harry's face is red with anger. As he says the next few l it’s as if he is stepping on an emotional gas peddle. He from straight to ENRAGED in eight words.  31.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Last night there was a fight in Harlequins. Started by this guy and his friends. My cousin, Sally Perigan. She was bottled. She's still in the hospital Frank grimaces. Justine looks to Stevo. She’s not happy a what she is hearing Bernie looks blank. Chris looks at Or Looks at Ord’s hands. Frank talks very slowly and deliberately.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We are here for work. Not to talk about the rights or wrongs of particular bar fights.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: I agree. Harry twitches. He is on the rack here. He knows this is wrong place. But his sense of righteousness is eating him alive.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Her face is fucked up... Vernon smiles in a fatherly way.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: Well, that’s something you will have to take care of another day.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: We can sort this thing out later Harry

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: He ground the glass into her face.

dialogues.speaker: STEVO
dialogues.text: I wasn’t there. This is bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Was he all banged up after last night?

dialogues.speaker: STEVO
dialogues.text: I walked into a door. I’ve never been to that bar. Stevo is stepping forward towards Harry. Bernie is natura moving in. Harry is moving forward with Gordon as his win man. It’s coming together. It’s like it wants to happen.

dialogues.speaker: STEVO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I didn’t start it.. You motherfucker!  32.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: You need to stop talking now. Stevo punches Harry. Harry falls back. He scrambles to hi feet and grabs at Stevo. The two men fall to floor in a f of punches and short screams of exertion. Ord looks over to Chris and shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Christ. Ord and Frank move in and pull the two men apart. They gr them and pries them open. Chris is putting a little distance between himself and th others. Ord and Frank have hold of the flailing men.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: YOU FUCKING SHIT. I’LL KILL

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: I will Harry, but you have to relax. Ord looks to Chris. He can see Harry is about to go. Ther a moment when the fire could catch again just on the vapo Harry wipes his face, he is so conflicted. He’s never bac down in a fight before. Stevo is released by Frank and is wiping blood from his n and gasping for air. Harry looks around at the other men. Chris puts out his h flat and bends down a bit. It’s placatory body language. is talking slowly. The sound has shifted now... It feels muffled. Variously the characters are entering into an endorphin state as their bodies flood with adrenalin.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: I’m sorry to hear about your cousin. But we are taking these guns now and leaving. Ord lets go of Harrys’ arm. Chris backs away to give hims a bit of distance. He instinctively knows what’s about to down.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Let’s go Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Okay... that’s okay... Harry goes to walk away. He talks quietly. Defeated.  33.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She was only 17. Stevo watches Harry walk away

dialogues.speaker: STEVO
dialogues.text: Then she shouln’t have been out should she? Chris is watching Harry’s hands. He looks over to Martin. Chris’s hand twitches. He looks back. Harry twists in Martins’ arms pulling a snub-nosed 38. Or sees and pushes forward to get to Harry.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: No! Harry fires at Stevo. Time slows. Flare flashes from the muzzle of the snub-nose. Stevo is hit in the shoulder. It opens up in an explosion material and blood. In one action his hand pulls out his M1911 hand-gun from jacket. Stevo falls. Frank looks on in low resignation. This is his fault for bringing the idiot along. Justine looks at Ord. Can he help stop this? Ord catches Justine’s look. It’s out of his hands now. Martin grabs at Harry, trying to stop him. The men all st at each other for a moment. Frank steps backward and gets ready to pull. Chris scans back and forth to see which way this is going go. There is a split second where this fight might not escala But Chris knows as soon as the first shot is fired, the g will come out and there’s no other place to go. Bernie looks on, frozen to the spot. Gordon takes a step back. He looks on blankly. Martin takes a step back. He is staring at Stevo falling. Martin bumps into the table. The AR18 and a detached maga falls off it.  34. Vernon looks at Chris and sees the look. He doesn't even think and goes for his pistol. Ord staggers back looking for cover. He shifts his body weight out of the line of fire of Stevo. Vernon pulls his pistol. A Colt Cobra. A snub-nosed 38. Chris quick draws his pistol; a police 38. He tucks his a in, so that his hand is in close to his hip. (A classic c combat stance.) Frank pulls his pistol. A Browning 9mm automatic. Martin pulls his. A 44 Python. He cocks it. He looks arou for a target. Ord moves backwards towards the AR18 cases. Vernon fumbles with the safety catch on his pistol. Chris has hunckered down to make as small a target as possible and is trying to get to cover. He sees the pilla out of his periphery vision. Tactically, he figures there too many people to engage. He needs to move and shoot to to a safe position. Justine pulls her pistol - a 38 police special. She nervo looks around. Bernie is frozen. His hands come up slowly. He wants no p in this. Harry fires again. The hammer smashing down on a bullets’ percussion cap. It fires, igniting the gunpowder. The pis kicks as the bullet exits. The cylinder turns and engages another cartridge. The bullet whistles past Stevo’s head as he falls backwar Ord pulls out his pistol from a kneeling position. A Colt M1991A1 Compact. Stevo fires his automatic. The pistol spits fire. The sli jerks back and a shell casing ejects. The high calibre slug misses Harry and hits Gordon; blowi his ear off. His long hair blows in the air at the impact Gordon grabs the side of his face as blood arcs out of hi head. He starts to scream but he is trapped in syrup like a dream. Vernon is nervously fiddling with his pistol trying to un the safety while backing away. Bernie is watching events unfold around him. He is still frozen.  35. Ord takes aim on Chris. He tracks him in the iron sights his automatic. It’s hard to hit him as Vernon moves acros his line of sight. Chris fires in twos. Double taps. TAP TAP. He hits Martin close range. A gob of gore sprouts from Martins’ head. Stevo hits the floor. He is still firing. A second bullet chambers. BANG - a spent cartridge spins across space... He totally misses Harry. The bullet screams off wide. A l in the ceiling explodes. Sparks fly. Martin drops to his knees. Blood spits from his head. Ord fires on Chris. Misses the first shot and hits him wi the second. Winging his arm. Ord is concentrated on his i sight. He tries to control the dump of adrenalin that’s i his system. He starts to experience tunnel vision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy 40. Slim, black jacket, steps out of the shadows wi his Ml carbine. He licks his fingers and wets the iron si at the end of his rifle. He watches for a moment as shots fired in the distance. Gunsmoke is gathering in the air. looks nervous; this wasn’t the plan. He looks to the far of the warehouse and sees a second rifle man... Howie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Far away from the action we find Howie. 53. Pot bellied. White whiskers. Dark hunting jacket. He takes aim with an Garrand. He looks stressed. He looks over to Jimmy's position. Is this what they should be doing? We see down his iron sight. In the distance we see the gu battle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vernon fires his pistol at Stevo and the bullet nicks Ste thigh. Blood squirts out. He turns and fires behind him. Shell casings ping into the air. Chris fires his 38 hitting Vernon’s arm. He staggers back Half running. It’s like he has been punched. Martin fires his pistol involuntarily. It kicks back. The ripple going down his arm.  36. The shot ricochets across the floor and whines towards Fr Frank almost bunny hops to the side in shock. Chris fires his pistol at Harry and hits him in the side. Harrys’ jacket puffs up and explodes with blood. The bull exits. Harry spins. Already off balance. Bernie starts to realize what’s happening around him and towards a pillar. Frank fires his pistol at Vernon. He fires wide and the r hits the van. It makes a low DUNK noise. Bang Justine darts right to avoid the gun fire.

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: Harry falls backwards and fires into the air. Another ricochet pangs off the light fixtures.

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: Stevo fires his third shot. It’s wide and inaccurate.

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: Gordon drops his pistol and grabs his head. Blood squirts through his fingers. He falls to the side and slides down side of the van. Harry collapses into the dust. INT. WAREHOUSE 200 METERS OUT. Jimmy looks at his watch. Midday. Jimmy squeezes off three shots with the Ml carbine. The s are loud and distinctive. WUDD. Clang WUDD, clang WUDD.. clang Brass casings roll around on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bullet smacks into Franks’ arm, spinning him round. Chr turns his head and sees the flash of the carbine for the first time. Bernie cowers behind the pillar. Bullets chasing through air. Gordon clambers too his feet and looks for an exit.  37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vernon dives out of the way. Harry tries to shield himsel from the incoming gunfire. It’s chaos. The initial pistol shoot-out is superceded by the introduction of much great fire power. The Ml Carbine fire continues in bursts of three. A shot wide and hits Gordon in the leg. He is spun around and collapses to the ground again.

dialogues.speaker: HOWIE
dialogues.text: This isn’t what we arranged.... Fuck fuck... Howie squeezes his trigger. His Ml Garrand fires. The sou is very distinctive. CHANK ting CHANK ting

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris hears the whine of Howies’ missed shot. He turns an makes eye contact with Ord. Ord looks at him from behind the AR18 boxes. They are the only two who know what’s happening. They are in a crossfi Chris gestures to Ord ‘What the fuck is this?’

dialogues.speaker: SOUNDS LIKE A FUCKING GARRAND.
dialogues.text: CHANK ting CHANK. ting Ord looks around in the boxes. He finds Vernons’ bag. Frank fires again at Vernon who is trying to move out of way. Vernon takes a round in the leg and as he falls he f again, hitting nothing. His jacket rips open and AR18 rou tinkle to the ground. Chris tries to take cover from the increasing rifle crossfire. Bullets zing through the air. He grabs one of AR18 rounds from the floor and picks up the fallen rifle. Vernon grabs at him.  38.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: Hey! Chris and Vernon struggle on the floor CHANK ting CHANK ting Chris grabs one of the loose rounds and stabs Vernon in t hand with it. Vernon recoils grasping his bloodied hand. Chris scoops up three more of the long 5.56 x 45mm bullet Frank is hit in the leg and collapses. Ord pulls out an AR18 from a packing case and slams the magazine into it. He racks it. He takes aim at Howie. CHANK — The Garrand magazine is empty and pops out of the Rifle. CLANG- (this is the sound of the cartridge ejecting on th Garrand. A design fault.) Chris aims the rifle and fires at Jimmy the rifleman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first shot chips concrete that goes into Jimmys’ eyes staggers back and stops firing. INT. WAREHOUSE. Ord fires at Howie. Howie is further off than Jimmy. The round cracks loud. A spent cartridge pings out of the rif

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howie struggles to reload his Garrand. The second and thi AR18 shots bite into the pillar. Howie ducks behind his pillar. INT. WAREHOUSE AR18 BOXES. Ord fires again to keep him pinned down. A bullet zings o the concrete from Jimmy. Ord turns 90 degrees and fires b in Jimmys’ direction. Bang bang bang bang  39. Chris scrambles looking for any more rounds. He finds one runs for a concrete column. Gordon is on the floor shouti Harry continues to fire at Stevo from the ground. Stevo i hit in the shin. His leg explodes and he screams in agony

Chris takes careful aim with the AR18 and fires. INT. WAREHOUSE 200 METERS OUT. Jimmy is shot through the chest and falls to the ground. INT. WAREHOUSE WEST PILLAR. Chris turns to look at the situation. Harry fires at Just

dialogues.speaker: HOWIE
dialogues.text: Goddamn. He loses his nerve and makes a run for the far door. Howi old, fat and out of shape... he huffs and puffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

Justine looks around and sees Howie is immobilised. Under van she can see the shapes of the other men. She crawls a towards a low wall. Chris looks to Frank. Frank is on the floor trying to cra away from the others towards the relative safety of the S PILLAR. Chris runs low to get to help Frank and is hit by Gordon. collapses in the dust. His gun skitters away. Stevo takes aim and shoots at Gordon. He misses. The echoes of the shots ring around the space. Bernie looks around. He sees the various positions where people are hiding. He is the only one not wounded. He loo to the door where the truck came in. Justine looks at her wounds. She rips her jacket and make tourniquet for her leg. She looks at her pistol and reloa it from her hand bag. She empties out the contents. Purse. Keys. Mouth spray. Perfume. Dental floss. Sanitary towel. Speed loaders *2. Needles. She breathes heavily. She peaks over the wall at the devastation. We see the warehouse in wide. Everybody is down. Smoke ha in the air. Justine can see that Frank has almost finished pulling himself over to the far pillar. He has a painful 10 metre go. Bernie gets up and makes a run for the steel shuttered ex He sprints across open ground.  41. Stevo is crawling away from the van trying to get a shot Gordon and Harry. Vernon shoots Bernie. Bernie jerks as he is hit. He keeps trying to move forward but collapses. Stevo sees Bernie collapse to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: Bernie crawls along for a bit but stops. His breathing becomes slower. He dies. Stevo looks on devastated.

dialogues.speaker: STEVO, (CONT'D)
