dialogues.text: Jimmy opens his eyes. He is laying on his back. Blood is pouring out of his chest. He tries to rub the blood from his eyes. Jimmy POV. We see he is partially blind

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Oh Christ. He rubs his eyes. He finds a tap and pours some water and cleans his eyes. He sees he is bleeding profusely. He tri to get to his feet. He can’t. He sees he has dropped the carbine a way away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry shuffles backwards towards a concrete pillar. He tu and looks at the situation. He is caked in blood. He look see how much ammo he has. INT. WAREHOUSE. LOW WALL. Justine gets her lighter out of her pocket and puts it wi the collected contents of her handbag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is an eerie silence in the warehouse. Smoke lazily drifts away. Light finds it and filters through. We visit each of the combatants... Jimmy the Rifleman:  42. Jimmy has propped his head against the pillar and is conscious but badly wounded Harry: Harry is on the floor. He’s been hit twice, but nothing l threatening... yet. He looks about wildly. Bernie: Bernie is face down. Dead. Frank: Frank is laying on the ground. He is breathing steadily trying to calm himself. Resting before attempting the las few meters to the South pillar. Vernon: Vernon is trying to stop his leg bleeding. He looks nervo to Ord. Gordon Gordon is in shock. He is holding his bleeding head. Howie the Rifleman: Howie is alive but crippled. He lays in a growing puddle blood. Martin: Martin is laying face down in his own blood. It bubbles a breathes. Stevo: Stevo is crawling away slowly. Trying to make it to the S pillar. He’s been crying. Justine: Justine is ripping off her trouser leg and picking the material out of the bullet wound. Ord: Ord is watching and thinking. He looks at all the people involved and tries to think where this will go next. Chris: Chris rests against the pillar. He looks at his hand. It’ shaking. He holds it with the other hand to stop the trem  43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ord pokes his head around from the boxes and makes eye contact with the other guys.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Who's alive? Harry? Harry is laying behind some rubble

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I’m hit.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Vernon? Vernon is by the van.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: My leg.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Move back towards me. You are out in the open there. Vernon takes in a deep breath and starts to crawl away. H hauls himself painfully back towards the AR18 boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank makes his way toward the south pillar. He manages t get onto one foot and stagger towards it. Harry fires at him. The shot goes way wide.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Stop shooting.. What are you doing? Frank makes it to the pillar and slumps Stevo rolls onto his side and fires a shot at Harry. He misses as well. Harry ducks behind his pillar. Stevo crawls around toward the East pillar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vernon crawls on all fours towards the AR18 packing cases methodically puts one hand in front of the other. He eventually makes it. Ord pulls him in. INT. WAREHOUSE EAST PILLAR. Stevo makes it to the pillar. He looks around. He sees Fr Frank makes a hand gesture... stay there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justine rips her trouser. INT. WAREHOUSE EAST PILLAR. Chris gets himself together from behind his pillar. He lo about and assesses the situation. He looks at his 38. 5 s left. He looks over to Justine as he hears the ripping of her trousers.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Justine. There is no answer

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Justine!

dialogues.speaker: JUSTINE
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: It’s Chris... how are you?

dialogues.speaker: JUSTINE
dialogues.text: I’m hit in the leg... Chris shuffles over to her position. Using the low wall a cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ord looks over his wounds. He goes through his pockets. H finds a hip flask. He opens it and sniffs it. He smiles. INT. WAREHOUSE. LOW WALL. Justine looks at the wound in her leg. She sees that it’s and out. She picks the bits of trouser out of the wound w a pair of tweezers. Chris crawls into view.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Where did those guys come from?

dialogues.speaker: JUSTINE
dialogues.text: I don’t know.. They were waiting though.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: I knew it. Those bullet strikings on the pillars I saw. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They were range markings. They had time to practise. She opens her mouth wash. She uses it to clean the wound her leg. She flinches as it pours on. She squirts some perfume on the wound as well. The alcohol works as an antiseptic.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah. You think they were with Ord and Vern?

dialogues.speaker: JUSTINE
dialogues.text: Independents I’d say. Maybe they got wind of the deal? Justine pulls a needle out of her bag

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Maybe... You badly hurt? Justine threads the dental floss into her needle. She use her lighter to sterilize its end.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTINE
dialogues.text: No.. I don’t think so.. Justine uses the dental floss to stitch her leg together. Chris looks on in amazement.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was trained as a nurse... She uses a sanitary napkin as a bandage. Chris is impress She looks at his wounds. She squirts some perfume at his wound.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This looks okay.. just clipped you. She pulls up his trouser.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is bad though. Chris looks at her sadly and smiles. She pokes around at bit more.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Looks straight through... She starts to make a bandage for him. She stitches up the gash in his side. He grits his teeth as the needle goes i

dialogues.speaker: JUSTINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Such a baby.  46. She ties the leg wound tight with a bandage.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is going to go septic in about 48 hours...

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: We will be out of here by then. Chris isn’t sure he believes what he has just said. She looks over the edge of the wall to see what’s going o She sees movement over at the AR18 crates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon sees Stevo moving through the wheels of the van. H looks down on the floor and sees a chunk of his own ear. looks back to Stevo.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Hey you fucker... Where are you going? He aims his pistol and fires. A bullet skids into the concrete floor near Stevo. Stevo keeps moving. Gordon starts crawling towards him.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Hey Gordon... Get back here.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch... shot me... Gordon crawls to the van. Stevo is crawling away. Gordon crawls out to get a shot at Stevo. He takes aim. Frank takes a shot at him and makes him ret behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ord looks over to Gordon. Vernon looks about. He sees whe Justine and Chris are. Franks position. He looks at Berna dead body. He looks over to Martin and Howie collapsed. H thinks for a moment. There are a lot of dead and dying pe here. He’s coming to a conclusion. Ord sees him thinking.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: What do you want to do?  47.

dialogues.speaker: VERN
dialogues.text: I want to go home Ord smiles..

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: I see we have three options... One: we leave, two: we shoot it out with them, three: we negotiate.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: Here's the thing. We have four bodies already and a load of guns. This is a very bad situation.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Yeah

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: I think the only way out now is to kill them all.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Oh Vern. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: This is the logical play. We can’t take the risk. Ord looks around at the damage. He looks over to where Ji was. He sees he is moving about.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Who the fuck was that guy?

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: The Micks looked as surprised as us.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Who knows from our side outside of the Corsican?

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: Maybe it was Justine..

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: What would she have to gain?

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: How well do you know anyone? Situations change.. People like us already take a lot a risks. What’s one more? Vernon looks over to her... He’s already decided a course action. He looks back to Martin’s inert body  48.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I worked with him for 10 years. INT. WAREHOUSE WEST PILLAR. Jimmy is sobbing. He looks at his hand. He can see colour the edge of his vision. He gets out his wallet and takes a picture of his wife and child. Jimmy sobs. He tries to pull him self together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justine peers over the top of her wall. She sees Ord pop head over the AR18 crates and look about.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: ORD’ HEY JUSTINE. I HOPE YOU DIDN’T GET

dialogues.speaker: WE GOTTA WORK THIS OUT.
dialogues.text: We hear Frank echoing in from the South pillar:

dialogues.speaker: FORGE.T IT SWEETHEART, HE KNOWS
dialogues.text: HE’S BEAT

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: WHAT’S THAT FRANK?

dialogues.speaker: TILL OUR GUYS TURN UP LOOKING FOR
dialogues.text: US. WON’T BE LONG NOW.

dialogues.speaker: SURE FOR NOW
dialogues.text: There’s a long moan... Ord looks over in the direction of collapsed Howie

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: YOU AIN’T GOING TO NEED AN AMBULANCE...

dialogues.speaker: HOWIE
dialogues.text: I’M SHOT...

dialogues.speaker: FUCKKK OFFF...
dialogues.text: Frank looks at the blood in his hand. Vernon is thinking. is mulling over the voice of the shooter.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: I know that voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris and Justine lay next to one another.  50.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Who are we dealing with here?

dialogues.speaker: JUSTINE
dialogues.text: Ord is an ex-military guy they bring in to have a bit of sensible muscle. Martin and Vernon are the connections. I deal through their boss. The kids I dont know.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Ord seems like someone we can work with.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTINE
dialogues.text: He wont panic.. The others...

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: You should stay here.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTINE
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: I’m getting over to the others.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTINE
dialogues.text: Why would you leave me here?

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: You have to stay independent. If you align with us, they will kill you. The first opportunity you get you have to get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTINE
dialogues.text: Can think you can win?

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: At the end of the day a battle is won by the side that gives up last. I ain't dieing here

dialogues.speaker: JUSTINE
dialogues.text: You think you have the most reason to live?

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: I’ve got an ideology at least. These guys have just got money.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTINE
dialogues.text: Money can mean a lot of things. It can mean freedom. People will do anything for freedom. Justine looks shaky.  51.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: I won’t let them hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTINE
dialogues.text: It’s too late for that. Chris starts to make his way over to the South pillar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ord is moving about dragging bags of rubble over and putt them up against the AR18 boxes. Harry watches from his position by the van. Harry shouts to Stevo and whoever is listening.

dialogues.speaker: FUCK YOU
dialogues.text: Vernon hisses over to Harry.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: I should put one in you, you little bastard. Ord turns to Vernon

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Those other shooters are independents. This would have gone down like this whatever happened. In fact, Harry’s lunacy may have helped us.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: How so?

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Because without the initial gunplay the shooters would have caught us completely off guard. Ord puts another bag of rubble up against the wooden crat

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Building a fort?

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Do you think wooden boxes stop bullets?

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: Don’t they?  52.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: You watch too much TV. Do you think a stud wall stops a bullet?

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: I guess not.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Do you not know the difference between concealment and cover? Vernon registers the error of his ways.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: Christ Vernon joins in building the barricades.

dialogues.speaker: HOWIE
dialogues.text: Ohhhhhhhhhhhhbhhhhhbhhhhhrgh. Vernon stops and frowns.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: Is that you Howie? There is a pause.

dialogues.speaker: HOWIE
dialogues.text: Yeah... that you Vern?

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: Yeah, it is. What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: HOWIE
dialogues.text: It was a score... I didn’t know it would be you.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: Well it fucking was...

dialogues.speaker: HOWIE
dialogues.text: I've been hit bad Vern.. You gotta call an ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: Who hired you?

dialogues.speaker: HOWIE
dialogues.text: You promise you will get me some help?  53.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: Sure. INT. WAREHOUSE. LOW WALL. Justine listens to the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: You have to tell me who hired you.

dialogues.speaker: HOWIE
dialogues.text: I suppose it’s academic now. Justine looks over and she can see Howie in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon is watching as things play out. He holds his bleed head. He can see Howie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris watches. He looks to Frank at his pillar. Chris sha himself together. He crouches and stands up unsteadily. H gets ready to run. He slouches forward and hobbles toward Franks position. He gets half way across when he is noticed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry takes a feeble shot at Chris. The shot whines past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vernon is talking to Howie.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: I'll get you out of here Howie - just tell me who hired you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank fires back at Harry. Chris approaches Franks pillar falls in behind it. INT. WAREHOUSE. Howie is still laying on his front. No amount of medical is going to help him. He licks his bloody lips trying to talk.  54.

dialogues.speaker: HOWIE
dialogues.text: Vern.. VERN.. Suddenly two shots ring out. HOWIE IS SHOT IN THE HEAD. H rolls over obviously dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ord looks around trying to work out who took the shot. General gun smoke is wafting about. Vernon looks around wildly

dialogues.speaker: HOWIE
dialogues.text: Ord rubs his face. This is a fucked up situation. Vernon ducks back down.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He’s fucking dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris collapses on the ground exhausted. He props him sel and looks back to Justine. She looks back at him and smil weakly. He nods back and turns to Frank.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Here we are...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Good to see you.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Your brother in law is a fucking idiot. Frank looks miserable and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Do you think they have anyone coming?

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: I think they have troubles of their own. Someone set up the shooters. And it looks like the last one got shot.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I didn’t see where it came from.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: If any ones coming for them it isn’t any time soon. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ord never says anything by accident. He wouldn’t give away an advantage like that.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I never told Leary where we were going.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: He might work it.. Chris tries to hide his defeat.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: He’s an idiot. He is never going to put it together. Chris looks out to the far door where the van came in.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: We can’t let them leave. If they get outside we are fucked. Look at all these bodies.. FRANK. Well we can cover the back door. I don’t think anyone is going to be making any sudden movements.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Even if we could make it out. We can’t leave without the guns

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I don’t think that’s a priority at this point.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: We are on fairly thin ice with our friends at home without losing a shitload of money and guns. We have to make this work.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We can but try.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: The biggest problem we have is if they have any ammo for the AR18’s. Frank hadn’t considered that until this moment. Franks fa crumples depressed.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Brilliant.  56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stevo suddenly gets up on one leg and starts shuffling towards a bit of cover. He gets there safely. He looks out around the warehouse and licks his lips. He makes another shuffle across the warehouse. Towards Frank Chris. INT. WAREHOUSE SOUTH PILLAR. Stevo collapses in front of the pillar. Frank grabs him a pulls him in. He is barely conscious

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Steven... Steven...

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: He’s passed out. They wait for a minute. Stevo starts to fit. The two men to stop him from smashing his head on the concrete. They wrestle with him. He stops fitting and Frank holds him in arms for a moment. The two men are exhausted. Stevo opens eyes.

dialogues.speaker: STEVO
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry Frank... Frank looks at him for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It’s done now. They sit there for a moment breathing heavily

dialogues.speaker: COMPLETE... THOSE ARE OUR GUNS AND
dialogues.text: THAT’S YOUR MONEY... THAT’S NOT

dialogues.speaker: WITH THE GUNS... YOU WANT THE
dialogues.text: MONEY... WHAT’S HAPPENED HERE... IT’S UNFORTUNATE BUT WE HAVE TO SEE THROUGH IT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vernon looks at Ord. He doesn’t like it.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON, (WHISPERING)
dialogues.text: What if she hired the shooters? What if she leaves here and she contacts the Irish... I shot that kid and you shot Howie - that’s murder. That’s the death sentence in Massachusetts.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: We cant settle this...

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: We have more people... We have the guns. Ord looks at him depressed. Vernon doesn't understand the situation.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: OKAY CHRIS. SENSIBLE. OKAY. LET’S DO IT. IT’S A DEAL. ARE YOU GOOD

dialogues.speaker: DEAL
dialogues.text: Justine gets ready to move. She staggers to her feet and starts to move. She is very wobbly.

dialogues.speaker: YOU NEED HELP THERE JUSTINE
dialogues.text: Chris throws over a broom.

dialogues.speaker: USE IT AS A CRUTCH.
dialogues.text: Justine grabs the brush and uses it to take the weight of busted leg. She starts to pick up speed. Suddenly a phone rings in the distance.. The sound echoes across the space. Ringing and ringing... then stops... Chris looks at Frank. Vernon looks at Ord. Justine listens to the phone. She realizes that the sound changes everything. Whoever gets to the phone first... Ord looks over to a clicking junction box on the far wall Ring Ring Ring Ring Vernon looks over to Justine hobbling along. Ring Justine hobbles faster. Ring Chris looks over to Vernon and Ord. He can see them talki  59.

dialogues.speaker: HEY.. NO..
dialogues.text: Ring

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Vernon.. wait. Vernon has his pistol out. He starts to raise it. Ord kno what he is about to do. Vernon aims his pistol at Justine.

dialogues.speaker: YOU STAY RIGHT THERE HONEY.
dialogues.text: Justine tries to go faster. Vernon fires. Ord tries to grab the pistol. The shot goes wide. Justine dives to the ground. NORTH WEST of the van. Then silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ord listens to the phone. He looks at Vernon. Vernon look grim faced. There’s a silence.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: Do you think shes dead?

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Hard to tell.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: She’s alive! Vernon looks over to where she fell and takes aim INT. WAREHOUSE NORTH WEST OF VAN. Justine is laying in the rubble. She squirms along on her belly to find better cover. Vernon is fires at her. She tries to crawl away. Bullets are flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vernon and Ord lay behind the boxes. Vernon takes aim aga  60.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: If she gets out then we are dead men. You understand that? INT. WAREHOUSE SOUTH PILLAR. Chris speed reloads. Points his pistol up at 90 degrees. Plunges the empty brass out and uses a speed loader from pocket.

dialogues.speaker: STEVO, (DELERIOUS)
dialogues.text: I don’t know why you use a pistol... Chris peers around the pillar and watches as Vernon takes shots at Justine. She looks back to him panicked. He got in this situation.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Six for sure rather than seven for maybe. Stevo rolls his eyes. He looks at his 45. Chris looks at too.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shooting is all about placement. Your guy is still going isn’t he? Stevo takes the point. He looks out into the warehouse an sees Bernie’s dead body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justine crawls. INT. WAREHOUSE SOUTH PILLAR. Chris looks around and sees a trolley. He grabs it and pu it over. He sees a bag of rubble. They pile it on the trolley.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: I’ve got to go over there.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: This is not a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Shes out in the open. We have to draw the fire.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We are not responsible for her.  61.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Come on, you don’t mean that.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You are going to get fucking killed.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: I‘1l push it along the line of those broken foundations... I can fall back along that if it goes wrong. Frank knows there’s no convincing him.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Okay Chris. Chris pushes the trolley forward. It takes a lot of effor He edges out into open space. He makes eye contact with Justine. She looks scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ord can hear a squeaking noise. It’s the sound of the tro wheels. He moves over to the edge of the boxes and takes look. Vernon shifts over to have a look as well. He sees trolley being pushed by Chris. It’s loaded with refuse ba of rubbish. Chris can be seen bobbing about behind it. Ord looks over to where the trolley seems to be heading.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: They are trying to flank us. Vernon takes aim and fires. A plume of dust explodes from top of the refuse bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris flinches as the bullets impact the bag and the trol There’s a small flash from the South pillar and a wooden impact as Frank shoots at them. Vernon ducks down. Ord hunkers down low. Wood chips explode around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justine watches as Chris makes his advance. INT. WAREHOUSE SOUTH PILLAR. Frank makes them count. Stevo aims and fires. Frank stops Stevo firing.  62.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We just need to make them keep their heads down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ord watches as the trolley edges along at a snails pace.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: What ammo are you shooting?

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: 9mm hollow point.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Well that’s not going to do anything. It’s just going to blat off those refuse sacks.. What they got in them? Rubble?

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: Sure He aims and fires again.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: You are wasting your time. Aim for the wheels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris pushes the trolley forward. The bullets chip wood o of the makeshift barrier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justine starts to crawl back to the low wall. She looks o to Chris. She knows he is risking his life for hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ord watches as the trolley approaches. He looks around hi for something to use. He pulls the hip flask out of his pocket and takes a swig. He takes another shot. This time ricochets and breaks the axel of the trolley. The trolley collapses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris scrambles for cover as the trolley falls to pieces. Bullets rip across the concrete. Chris rolls - cursing.  63. He looks at the route back to the pillar. He can see a ba rubble he could use as cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vernon fires blindly. Ord doesn’t look so confident. He looks round and sees Justine disappearing behind a pillar on the west side. He realizes the plan. INT. WAREHOUSE COLLAPSED TROLLEY. Chris crawls back to the bag of rubble as fast as he can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ord and Harry take it in turns to shoot at Chris.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Take your time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dust flies in the air as the bags are hit by pistol fire. Chris cowers behind the bags. He sees an aerosol can on t ground. He picks it up. INT. WAREHOUSE SOUTH PILLAR. Frank and Stevo continue to return fire. Frank sees that Justine has made her way back to her low wall position. H smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ord ducks behind the boxes as a salvo of shots fly in his direction. INT. WAREHOUSE BAGS OF RUBBLE. Chris grabs the aerosol can and throws it towards the AR1 boxes. INT. WAREHOUSE SOUTH PILLAR. Frank sees the aerosol go over.  64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris watches as the aerosol rolls towards the boxes. He steadies his hand and takes aim. He shoots. Misses. He sh again and hits. The canister explodes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ord and Vernon duck for cover as they are blown off their feet.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: What the fuck was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris crawls out from his cover towards the South pillar. moves methodically forward. Pulling himself along. He loo back to the AR18 Boxes. The small explosion hadn’t done m damage. He looks ahead and sees Frank and Stevo at the pillar. Frank is beckoning him in. INT. WAREHOUSE SOUTH PILLAR. Chris is pulled behind the pillar by Frank and Stevo. Chr is exhausted. Frank grabs his head and hugs him.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You mad bastard.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Did she make it?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Yeah. Chris looks round and sees Justine by the low wall. She l back and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ord chuckles to himself.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: What are you laughing at?

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: This guy is a problem... Trying to flank us with a bag of rubble and a trolley... He’s got heart.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: He’s an idiot... For what... That woman he doesn't know?  65. INT. WAREHOUSE SOUTH PILLAR. Chris and Frank plan.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: We have to get to that phone and call in Leary. Frank looks over to the stairs in the far corner of the warehouse. He looks back to the AR18 cases.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I’1l go.

dialogues.speaker: STEVO
dialogues.text: I should go.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I’ve already got you shot when I was supposed to be looking out for you.

dialogues.speaker: STEVO
dialogues.text: I am a big boy.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It’s not you I am worried about, it’s my sister. I promised her you would be alright.

dialogues.speaker: STEVO
dialogues.text: Ill do it...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I am going... I am the only one fit enough. Chris and Frank look at each other. There’s an understand Chris looks at the lay of the land.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: If you can get over towards the stairs it will be very hard for them to hit you. If you crawl low and use the rubbish for cover.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Sure. What have they got. Automatics and revolvers... it’s too far for a shot. He smiles winningly. The other two men are not so sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ord watches the South pillar. He looks at his leg wound a ties off the bandage.  66.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: They are going to go for the phone and bring their guys now.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: I can make it... You cover me.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: We should stay ensconced here.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: And wait for them to bring Rick O Shea and his brothers down here. Fuck that.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: We should get the ammo out of the van and overpower them.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: You had your chance. I’m not listening to you again. Ord looks at the distance and tries to run the play in hi head. Maybe...

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Let’s have a look at you. Ord looks at Vernon’s leg wound. He tidies up the bandage looks around finds some cardboard. He starts to rip it up

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: If you are going to crawl on the this floor you are going to need some pads.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: Are you kidding

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: The shit in this warehouse is more likely to kill us than bullets. Pigeon shit... Chemicals... And you are going to crawl around in it with open wounds... You need every bit of help you can get. He ties the cardboard around his legs.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: How the fuck did this happen... There’s a moment of calm between them. Ord appreciates wh Vernon is about to do even if it is crazy.  67.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Okay. Good luck. Vernon is now wearing his cardboard armor. He looks dejec He shuffles out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vernon crawls out to the back of the van. He looks over t the South pillar. He holds his leg and grimaces. He sees Frank making his way out. He holds his pistol up. It’s he We see the gun wobbling about. Vernon tries to steady it. can’t do it. He opens the cylinder to look at how many sh he has. He frowns. He puts his hand in his pocket and fin couple of bullets. He reloads his gun. He looks over and can see Frank is further away. He takes aim. He has even less chance of hitting him now. He looks on in frustration. Vernon holsters his pistol an with a nervous look over to the South pillar he prepares crawl. He looks back to Ord. Ord has his pistol aimed at pillar. He urges Vernon on with his eyes. Vernon lays as close to the ground as he can and starts t shuffle out from behind the cover of the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ord watches the South pillar. There is no movement. He lo back to Vernon who is now about 6 foot clear of the van. looks over to Frank in the distance. He notices movement behind the pillar. INT. WAREHOUSE SOUTH PILLAR. Chris watches from behind the pillar as Vernon is crawlin He takes aim. Stevo sees him too.

dialogues.speaker: STEVO
dialogues.text: HE’S COMING FRANK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank grunts as he crawls. He uses his arms to pull his b along, dragging his legs behind him. He has a steady pace now. He is pushing through detritus on the floor. Cartons abandoned refuge bags. He is huffing and puffing. He stop for a moment and looks over his shoulder. In the distance can see Vernon. He turns and looks toward the stairs. The lay about 500 meters away. Between him and the stairs are many obstacles.  68.

dialogues.speaker: STEVO
dialogues.text: Come on Frank... COME ON.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Go on FRANK.. MOVE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vernon is moving between refuse sacks. He pushes through them. He is about 100 metres from the South pillar. He ca see another pillar about 10 meters from his position. He looks to the South pillar and can’t see any movement.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: MOVE IT VERN... COME ON... HE’S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ord is following Vernon’s progress. He looks over to the South Pillar. Then back to Vernon.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: The ammo for the AR18’s is in the van?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Go and get it, then.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That’s pretty dangerous Ord. Ord looks at him in a way that Harry knows that he doesn' have a choice in the matter. Harry weighs up the threat. looks around and sees Gordon. Gordon looks at him with wi eyes. He looks back at Ord. He turns and starts to crawl back towards the van. It’s a 10 meters of open ground. INT. WAREHOUSE SOUTH PILLAR. Chris is watching the progress of Vernon

dialogues.speaker: STEVO
dialogues.text: Take the shot.  69.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: STEVO
dialogues.text: He shot Bernie like he was a dog in the street. Stevo FIRES HIS PISTOL. The shot goes wide of Vernon. Chr looks a Stevo wild eyed. He is wasting precious ammo.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Stop... Stevo continues to Fire. Chris grabs him

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I told you to stop..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vernon scrambles out of the way. He pulls his pistol and shoots back towards the South pillar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ord gets a clear shot of Stevo and takes it. He fires twi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry ducks and cowers as the shots start flying again. INT. WAREHOUSE SOUTH PILLAR. Brick shatters from the pillar. Shots are coming from bot sides. Chris pulls Stevo down to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justine sees Ord clearly firing at the South pillar. She takes a shot with her 38. She hits Ord in the arm. He duc down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vernon makes it to the far pillar. He reloads his pistol.  70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry makes it to the back of the van. He pulls the handl on the door. Nothing. He tries again. It’s locked. He looks depressed. He looks desperately to Chris... Then Martins’ body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ord looks over to Harry. Ord is trying to stop the bleedi from his new wound. He gestures to Harry to open the door Harry shrugs and makes a carkey mime. Ord looks over to where Martins lays. And then he looks back to Harry. Harry shakes his head. INT. WAREHOUSE SOUTH PILLAR. Chris and Stevo scramble on the floor. Chris is punching Stevo in the head. They thrash about - each man not stron enough to get the better of the other. Chris reaches down and grabs Stevo’s leg and forces his fingers into the bullet wound. He squeezes. Stevo screams passes out. The fight is over. Chris sits for a moment panting. He sh his head in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank keeps on going. He can see the stairs now. He looks back and can see smoke blowing across from the shoot out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry crawls towards Martin. He stops for a moment watchi the South pillar and then moves on a bit more. INT. WAREHOUSE FAR PILLAR. Vernon looks at Frank. He checks his pistol again. He tak aim and tries to support his hand. Again, he can’t do it. Vernon holsters his pistol then starts out again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank keeps moving. He looks back and can see Vernon in t distance. He winces and looks down at his hand.  71. It’s got a syringe sticking in it. It’s gone in quite dee He winces as he pulls it out and throws it to one side. T warehouse has obviously hosted junkies at some point. INT. WAREHOUSE. Harry gets over to Martins’ body. He turns him over. He h been shot in the head. Harry goes through his pockets try to find the keys to the van. Harry looks around and spots briefcase with the MONEY. He looks back to Ord. Ord shrug What are you waiting for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank arrives at the stairs. He looks up them. There is a steep flight then a landing, then they go up again. It mi as well be the north face of the Eiger. Frank hauls himse up the first step.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Come on boy... Frank pulls himself up. INT. WAREHOUSE TOWARDS THE STAIRS. Vernon is moving through the dirt towards the stairs. He the syringes. He manages not to get stuck by them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justine checks her pistol. She looks at Chris. He knows s is going to make a break for it. She starts to move away. Chris watches her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris watches as Justine disappears into his blind spot behind a large pillar and a line of broken office foundations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ord watches as Justine starts to shuffle away. He looks o to the back of the warehouse. He sighs.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Fuck.. Gordon

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: What  72.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: You have to stop her.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: You were all for letting her go

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Yeah. Situations change. She's obviously with them...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Why don’t you go? I came here to drive and move boxes.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Because I have to keep Chris pinned down. You are the only spare man we have. Ord looks over to Harry who is still searching Martins pockets. Ord sees in the distance the brief case with the money in. He looks back to Gordon who is also looking at

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: What do I get out of it?

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: I’ll pay you...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Half the money...

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Don’t push your luck. I’1l give you 10k. Gordon nods and then starts to move off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is crawling up the stairs. Stair after stair. He st every couple to rest a little. His world has been reduced down to a stairwell. He stops again and passes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vernon is approaching the bottom of the stairs. He is huf and puffing with exertion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justine is moving steadily and carefully.  73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon is crawling; following Justine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank opens his eyes. He looks around panicking. How long he been unconscious? He moves forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vernon gets around the corner of the stairs, looks up and sees Frank at the top. He pulls out his pistol. It gets caught in his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank gets to the landing of the stairs and starts to tur He sees Vernon at the bottom. He sees him trying to get h pistol out. Frank moves faster kicking his way forward. Vernon fires and misses. Plaster explodes out of the wall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank gets around the side of the stairs and pulls out hi pistol. He gets his breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justine is crawling away towards the door that they all entered into the warehouse by an hour beforehand. She is moving at a decent pace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon follows with grim determination. He sees Justine bobbing up and down in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry is going through Martins’ pockets. Suddenly Martin springs to life. Harry looks at the wound in the side of head. He can see bits of bone and brain.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Van keys?  74.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Get off me...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Where are the van keys?

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Where am I?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You are hurt. Keep still.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Why am I wet?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Keys?

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Get off me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vernon shuffles back and tries to make a small target of himself. He points his gun wildly. Like a priest might wi cross to ward off a vampire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank looks around the corner carefully. He sees that Ver has backed up. He looks up the next flight of stairs. He his pistol away and prepares for the next flight. He starts climbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry starts rummaging through Martins’ pockets more aggressively.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Why am I wet?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You were shot.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Where am I?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Keys?

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Why am I wet?  75. Martin starts to get up. He stands looking around the warehouse. He is like the first monkey to stand up on two legs. As he stands Harry’s grip rips his pocket and the k tumble out. Harry tries to pull him down. Martin kicks him off. He pu out his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where am I?

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Martin get down! Martin turns and shoots at Ord. Harry goes into a ball on floor.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Trying to trick me? Where is the money? He walks over to where Ord is hiding.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Get down!

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Trying to rip me off... Martin fires at Ord. Ord scrambles backwards trying to ge out of the way of the fire. He ends up behind a low wall north of the boxes. Bullets ping off the masonry.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Don’t make me shoot you Martin He looks up but Martin has gone. He looks around wild eye

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank gets to the top of the stairs and moves forwards. H slides on the floor. Blood smearing behind him. He scoots around into an open office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank shuffles into the office. There are a few desks. He can’t see over them. He moves forward and grabs a roller chair and tries to pull himself up so he can see if the p is in there. The first desk he tries is difficult. The ch slides from under him and he collapses on the floor. He curses. He turns the chair over and tries again. He gets the level of the desk and sees nothing. Frank grits his t in disappointment.  76. He looks around to the other desk and sees a phone. He ki with his foot to wheel his chair over to it. He grabs the phone and picks it up. It’s dead. He throws it to one sid He moves to get out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris watches as Martin moves about. He is looking for something.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Justinnne. Justinnne. INT. WAREHOUSE FAR DOOR. Justine makes her way into the corridor. She moves forwar Once the door closes behind her she gets up onto one leg starts to hobble along at a faster pace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vernon gets to the top of the stairs. He looks down the corridor and sees the blood trail. He pulls his pistol an takes aim to get Frank as he comes out of the office. He hear Martin howling in the warehouse.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Justinnnneeee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank waits breathing in shallow breaths. He looks to the door. He looks around the room and sees a paint pot. He g it, cleans it and pushes it out into the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vernon sees the paint pot slide into view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank looks at the shiny reflection on the paint pot.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I can see you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vernon shoots the paint pot.  77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris looks up as he hears the gunshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin is touching his head. He sees his hand is covered blood. He plays with the bullet wound. It seems not to hu It’s a horrific sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon is following Justine. He stops for a moment as he hears the gunfire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ord sneers. He can’t tell which way this is going. He loo from the far door (where Justine and Gordon are battling) the upstairs (where Frank and Vernon are), to around the warehouse. He spots Martin in the distance. He is approaching Howies corpse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank looks around the office. Its constructed mainly of plasterboard. He looks to the corner of the room near the door. He aims his pistol at the plaster and fires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vernon ducks down as the plaster explodes around him. He rolls down two steps of the staircase. INT. CORRIDOR. Justine moves over a plank and it bangs up and down makin noise. She moves on. Ahead of her is another door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank moves over towards the wall on far side. He uses hi good foot to kick his way through. He climbs into the hol has made and makes his way into the next office.  78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vernon crawls back up the stairs and heads out onto the corridor. He slides along the floor and cautiously looks the empty office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank crawls through the partition. It’s very dusty and f of pipes. Frank makes his way through the partition looki for an easy way through to the next room. There is an explosion as Vernon fires his gun. A beam of light sudden appears where the bullet has passed through the plaster b

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Oh Fuck. Frank scrambles for his life. He moves through the cablin and starts to kick his way through the next wall. There is another shot and another beam of light streaks through the tight space. Frank starts to panic. The cable wrap around him and he kicks and thrashes trying to get o of the way of the bullets. He starts to cough in the dust Frank wedges himself between the brick work and the plasterboard and starts to kick with his good leg. He sma his way through to the next office and pulls himself thro the small hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin is kicking Howies body.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: You fucking idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ord watches Martin. His curiosity piqued.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank looks around and sees that he is in a store room. H crawls through the boxes and mops. He stops for a moment exhausted. INT. CORRIDOR. Justine grabs the door handle and twists it. The door ope and she makes her way through. She closes the door behind her. She breathes for a moment. Then she starts on toward the next door.  79. INT. CORRIDOR. Gordon moves on through the door and into the corridor. H sees the door at the far end closing. He curses and tries move faster. He gets up and drags himself along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vernon looks around the empty room and then out into the corridor. He moves down the corridor towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank breathes shallow breathes as he sees a shadow move across the bottom of the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vernon tries the door. It’s locked. Suddenly the door explodes as Frank fires through it. Ver returns fire trying to match the trajectory. Dust and plaster fill the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the office, dust explodes as Frank shoots it out w Vernon. INT. WAREHOUSE UPSTAIRS. Vernon gets hit in the arm. He fires back blindly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank keeps firing until he runs out of bullets. Frank looks around him and notices the ground is wet. He sniffs the liquid. It’s some kind of cleaning fluid solve He looks low through the door and can just about make out Vernon. He grabs some more bottles of industrial solvent and pour them under the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry watches Martin moving about. He looks over to the briefcase with the money in. He looks over to Ord’s posit and then to the van  80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin kneels down at Howie’s body his head in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Simple simple plan... How could you be so stupid. He looks around nervously. Has he said too much. He picks Howie’s Garrand and scans about. He sees Chris watching h from the South pillar. He takes aim and fires. CHANK! ping. INT. CORRIDOR. Justine reaches the door. She reaches up to the door hand Her hand slips off it. She tries it again. The door is lo from the other side. It must have a dead lock. She fights back the tears. She listens for a minute. She hears the bang sound of the plank that she crawled over three minutes before. She fre and looks back. She shuffles to the side of the door in the darkness. She pulls out her gun and counts the rounds. She has two shot left. She flips the cylinder back into the frame and take aim at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris fires back at Martin. Martin fires another shot at Chris. Masonry explodes from the side of the pillar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vernon sees the liquid welling up from under the door. He isn’t sure what it means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank pours more of the liquid through. He holds a handkerchief to his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vernon watches as the liquid starts to lap around his fee He sniffs the air and starts to realize what’s about to happen. He looks around and sees a fire extinguisher on t wall.  81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank crawls over to the wall and starts to kick it throu He smashes it in and crawls through the hole. He lights t solvent slick as he leaves. A small blue flame rushes acr the floor and under the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flame shoots out from under the door and ignites Vern polyester and solvent soaked slacks. He starts kicking hi legs in pain. He throws himself toward the fire extinguis

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank smashes his way into the third office. He lays ther gasping as he hears Vernon screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vernon pulls the fire extinguisher off the wall and fumbl with the release on the nozzle. He is panicking. Finally gets it off and he is covered in a cloud of white smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ord watches the shoot out between Chris and Martin. He ta aim but can’t get a clear shot of either of them. We can he is weighing up the odds. INT. CORRIDOR. Gordon pushes the door open and starts to make his way in raises his pistol attempting to protect himself. Justine fires. The first shot is wide and hits the door. Gordon f blindly and the shot pings into the wall. Justine fires h last bullet and hits Gordon in the shoulder. He rolls ove and drops his pistol. It skitters across the floor. The smoke settles for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank finally sees the phone and crawls towards it. He smiles. It’s like completing a marathon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin empties the Garrand and drops it. He touches his h again. He is feeling dizzy.  82. INT. WAREHOUSE ENTRANCE CORRIDOR. Gordon coughs. He looks around. He is dazed. Justine look the pistol. It’s closer to her than it is him. She starts shuffling towards it. Gordon turns angrily and starts moving towards it. The tw them move towards the gun.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: You get away from that. Justine has her 38 in her fist. Gordon gets to the pistol before Justine. He grabs at it. Justine brings the 38 dow hard on Gordan’s fingers. He screams and she hits him aga His fingers are broken. His pistol skitters away even further. Justine looks over to it and then back to Gordon Gordon realizes what she is thinking and jumps forward wi all his might. He grabs at her and they grapple on the fl Justine smacks her 38 into his wounded head. His hands cr over her face trying to smother her. She bashes at his he with the gun like it’s a hammer. She reaches out for the other pistol. Gordon uses his other arm to choke her. Justine bites int his broken fingers. He screams. Justine spits out a finge She grabs the pistol and shoots Gordon in the face. He fa back looking shocked. Blood runs down his face from a hol below his eye. He breathes heavily as he looks at her. Sh fires again and kills him. Gordon falls to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank to the phone and picks up the reciever There is a volley of shots through the office door. The g paneling falls away to reveal Vernon. Gunsmoke drifts fro his pistol. Frank collapses to the ground DEAD. The phones dead tone can be heard: DRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin looks around wildly. He sees the money and makes a beeline for it. He marches over and grabs it. Harry watches from his position. Chris watches from the pillar.  83. Martin looks up at the sunlight and is mesmerized for a moment. He starts to walk. Not in the right direction. He walks manically. Slowly he starts to wind down. His walki gets slower. He eventually stops and drops the briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Where am I? Did it work? Did we get the money? He falls to the ground DEAD. INT. WAREHOUSE ENTRANCE CORRIDOR. Justine sits up and gasps. She sucks in her lips and chec her teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vernon lowers his gun. His breathing is shallow now. He s there and doesn't move. He is very burnt. He is done. The fire dies out. INT. WAREHOUSE ENTRANCE CORRIDOR. Justine looks at the magazine of Gordon’s gun. 6 shots le She holsters her 38 after wiping the blood off it. INT. WAREHOUSE SOUTH PILLAR. Chris sits, looking back up at where the gunshots have co from. He shakes his head slowly.

dialogues.speaker: STEVO
dialogues.text: Do you think he made it?

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Sure. Stevo smiles. Chris looks at how pale Stevo is now. He ha lost a lot of blood. He looks like he is a t deaths door.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wake up Stevo..

dialogues.speaker: STEVO
dialogues.text: Sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: If you fall asleep, you wont wake up. You know that?  84.

dialogues.speaker: STEVO
dialogues.text: I am sorry Chris... sorry...

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: I’ve got to go and help Frank. You have to watch Ord. Can you do it?

dialogues.speaker: STEVO
dialogues.text: I’1l try man.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: You keep them pinned down. Judging by that gunfire, Justine didn’t get too far before that guy caught up with her

dialogues.speaker: STEVO
dialogues.text: Do you think she is dead? Chris doesn't want to believe she is dead. He moves off towards the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ord watches as Chris moves off towards the stairs. He loo around. He’s lost Gordon and he can’t see Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Harry pops his head up from behind a low wall. He sees Ch crawling. There’s a gun shot from Stevo and Ord is forced down again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve looks up and sees the staircase. He starts to climb makes a better job of it than Frank. Chris looks over the top of the stairs. He sees Vernon at end of the corridor. He looks like he might be dead. Chris takes aim at the man. He checks his ammo. Two shots puts the pistol back in its holster. He starts the long journey. Slowly moving hand over hand making his way forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justine crawls back through the door as quietly as she ca She scans the warehouse.  85. There is one way out of there and that’s through the back door. She looks to it. She crawls along the edge of the warehouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vernon is not dead. But he is very badly injured. He is breathing but in a very shallow fashion. We see Chris in distance moving towards him. Vernon opens his eyes for a moment and looks at the shot door that was between him and Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ord looks to the upstairs and then spots cabling coming o of the office. It’s the phone trunking. He sees it goes t box before going outside. He looks around and then makes a break for it. He shuffle forward, keeping a wary eye on the South pillar. INT. WAREHOUSE SOUTH PILLAR. Stevo is winking in and out of consciousness. He sees Ord can’t get it together to fire on him. He lifts his pistol then gives up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back inside the main warehouse. Justine looks around. She see the van and the AR18 Boxes. She moves away from them towards Jimmy’s pillar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris crawls along the floor, slowly slowly. He stops for moment and gets a pack of sweets out of his pocket. He ea one. Then he starts again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vernon registers that Chris is moving up the corridor. He looks around slowly with his eyes. Where did he drop his He sees it. Just out of reach. He sucks his cheeks for a of sustenance and considers his options.  86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris can see more clearly now. Vernon has been shot and burnt and is slumped against the wall. His pistol is abou metre away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vernon gets himself ready for his attack. He will only ge one go at this. He breathes in and then launches himself towards the pistol. His body hits the ground with a thud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris sees this movement and grabs for his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vernon's sticky bloody fingers grapple for the pistol. It monumental effort. Eventually he grabs hold and brings it bare. He pulls the trigger. The gun kicks out of his hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris is showered in plaster and dust as the bullet tears into the wall. He aims his pistol and fires. The bullet h Vernon in the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vernon scrabbles for the fumbled weapon. He grabs it and turns and aims. He can’t miss at this range. He pulls the trigger and hears a sickening click. The gun is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris has one last shot. He takes it and shoots Vernon in nose. Vernon slumps down - finally dead. Chris moves towa him and goes through his pockets. He has extra bullets fo his gun and a packet of peanuts. Chris devours the peanut

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up ahead, Justine can see the fallen body of Jimmy. She crawls over towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris kicks in the door to the office. He crawls in throu the hole.  He looks seems to beat, He over and 87. up and is startled to see the dead body of Frank. He be staring into space. Chris looks at him for a can’t believe it’s ended like this. He shuffles closes Franks eyes. Chris recites a poem.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Death is nothing at all. I am I and you are you. Whatever we were to each other, That, we still are. Chris gets to the telephone. He dials.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hello

dialogues.speaker: SANDY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hello

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Is Leary there?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No, he’s not here

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: He’s out, who is this?

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: It’s Chris

dialogues.speaker: SANDY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: He’s gone looking for you.. INT. WAREHOUSE TOWARDS THE PHONE JUNCTION. Ord is moving at a pace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justine gets to the pillar. She picks up Jimmy’s carbine drags it with her. Jimmy’s body is propped up in the corn He is DEAD. In his hand the picture of his wife and kids. Justine goes through his pockets. She hears a smashing no and looks up. She can see Ord ripping out the telephone junction from the wall.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Sandy is Barndon there.. Sandy...  88. He shakes the phone... It’s dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The 72 Plymouth Fury and the van are still parked up outs A third car pulls up. A man in a leather jacket gets out. looks around the vehicles. He walks over to the warehouse. INT. WAREHOUSE CORRIDOR. We see the man now. Leary. 29 tall. Confident. He strides along. Cigarette in his mouth. He looks in door ways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justine picks up the Ml carbine and lays on the ground an takes aim. She looks down the iron sight. She swipes the carbine across from the AR18 boxes to where she felt the sound was coming from. She sees Ord in the distance. He i standing by a cable box. She takes aim but too late he dr out of view. Black INT.WAREHOUSE JIMMY’S PILLAR Justine opens her eyes. She has passed out. She struggles bring herself around. Her eyes start to droop. She is pas out again. Her head nods down. Unconscious. Blood leaks f underneath her. INT. WAREHOUSE CORRIDOR. Leary enters through the dead-locked door. He sees Gordan body on the floor. He stops in his tracks. He pulls his pistol and looks around. He finds a bit of wood and prods at the body. He examines wounds in his head. He looks back to the door. This is a life or death situat Move forward or run away. Leary is just not the sort to g back. He carefully moves towards the next door. He sees t blood and bullet marks on it. He sees the blood drag marks on the floor.  89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leary enters the warehouse. He sees the van parked up in middle. He looks cautiously around the warehouse. It’s dead quiet Nothing is stirring. He sniffs the air. He detects a bit cordite.

dialogues.speaker: LEARY
dialogues.text: Hello? No sign of life. LEARY (CONT’D)

dialogues.speaker: HELLO CHRIS.. FRANK
dialogues.text: He moves cautiously into the Warehouse. He looks around. sees Martins’ body away off. He stops. He looks around. He can see the money on the floor near Martins’ body. He moves towards it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris has heard Learys’ voice. He makes his way towards t window. He can see Leary. He spots what’s about to happen. Harry hiding behind a pillar. Chris bangs on the glass.

dialogues.speaker: LEARY
dialogues.text: Leary takes a step forward and looks around. He steps forward again and Harry swings a tyre iron into shins. Leary falls and drops his gun. Harry leaps forward crushes his head with the tyre iron. Leary lays there twitching. ORD O.S.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah I got him. INT. WAREHOUSE BY THE PHONE JUNCTION. Ord looks over to Harry. He looks over to the stairs. He wonders if Chris will come back now.  90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris looks down distraught. He pulls himself through the door and makes his way back to the stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry goes through Leary’s pockets. He can’t find anythin worth keeping. Harry lays there for a moment thinking. He grabs the money. Harry pulls himself towards the Chevy.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Where are you going Harry? He inches slowly towards it. Pushing the money in front o him. Blood loss is affecting him now. He looks ahead, his vision drifting in and out of focus. He stops for a momen catch his breath.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (TO HIMSELF)
dialogues.text: Come on, come on... He tries to fortify himself. There is only him now and th task. He slides forward about an inch with each effort. Behind him he leaves a slick of blood.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Don’t do it Harry.. The van starts to loom ahead of him. He looks at the shin chromium trim. Notices the crusted dirt on the underside it for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris lowers himself down the stairs one by one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry arrives at the van. He huffs and puffs heavily. He rolls himself onto one side and uses the van as a backsto slide himself upright. He looks around woozily. He knows he is very vulnerable at this point. He also knows he has choice. This is going to happen. He hesitantly reaches up with his hand. It touches the cool metal of the van. He reaches up further and his hand gently touches the door handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ord takes aim with his automatic. He tracks Harry between crosshairs of this pistol. He pulls the trigger. CLICK  gl. The gun has jammed. Ord puts the safety on and drops the He turns the gun over but nothing drops out. He pulls the rack back and sees that two bullets have jammed in the breach. He tries unblock them but they are totally stuck. He grimaces. Fuck. He starts to strip the gun down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry grasps the handle. He waits a moment then flexes hi muscle to see if he can lift himself from the ground. He grimaces. Its going to be a massive effort.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: One, two, three... He pulls himself onto his knee. Then slides up the side o the van door. He sees himself in the wing mirror. Like a ghost. He is standing now. Holding himself up with the do and wedging himself in with his good leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris falls a couple of stairs. INT. WAREHOUSE BY THE PHONE JUNCTION. Ord is putting the pistol back together. He is almost the He looks up and sees Harry at the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry licks his lips and digs in his pocket for the van k He retrieves them and slots them in the door lock. He qui turns and hears the door click open. He pushes with his weight to get the door to swing open. He takes the keys out of the door lock and puts them in h pocket. He grabs the briefcase with the money and throws it in th van. Harry shuffles around the open door and crawls up a step toward the cab. He crouches in the well of the door step then forces him self up into the seat. He lays for a mome with his legs dangling out of the van. He looks towards t driving seat and steering wheel.  92. INT. WAREHOUSE BY THE PHONE JUNCTION. Ord finishes putting together his pistol. He takes aim. H pulls the trigger. Nothing. He still has the safety on. H clicks it and takes aim again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry starts to crawl across the two seats in the cab tow the driving seat. As he struggles his feet bash against t door of the van The wind shield shatters as Ord fires at the van. Glass covers Harry. INT. WAREHOUSE SOUTH PILLAR. Stevo is winking in and out of consciousness. He hears Or firing. He sees Harry’s feet sticking out of the van.

dialogues.speaker: STEVO
dialogues.text: Shit... Stevo rolls onto his knees and uses all his strength to b his pistol up and take aim at Harry. He can’t see his bod just his legs. He aims for a minute then stops. The pistol is too heavy. tries to get something to rest his aim on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry wriggles across the seats and grabs the steering wh with his right hand. He pulls himself forward. His feet disappear into the Chevy. The side window shatters as ano bullet hits it. INT. WAREHOUSE SOUTH PILLAR. Stevo realizes that his chance has gone. He drops his pis down for a moment conserving energy. He looks very pale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry gets into the drivers seat and puts his hand in his pocket to get the ignition key. As he pulls his hand out see it is slick with blood. He tries to select the igniti key from the bunch. His hands are slippery and it takes h few attempts to separate the keys. He finally finds the k and puts it in the ignition. He turns it.  93. The engine grinds into life. Harry allows himself a littl smile. He is very weak now. INT. WAREHOUSE SOUTH PILLAR. Stevo leans out from behind the pillar and fires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The windshield breaks again as Stevo shoots it. Shot low exits the roof of the van. Harry tries to dodge but it’s of a reflex action. Harry puts the van into gear and the deck jumps into life. John Denver’s “Annie’s Song” (this is followed by "It’s Up to You" "Cool an' Green an' Shady" "Eclipse") Harry puts his foot down on the accelerator and lurches forward. A second bullet hits Harry in the chest. He slumps back i his seat and grips the steering wheel. The Chevy is now moving at a snails pace. Harry slumps over the wheel. The Chevy starts to turn toward the South pillar in a lazy wi circle. INT. WAREHOUSE SOUTH PILLAR. Stevo is finding his range now. He takes another shot. Th puts a hole through the side of the Chevy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry is hit and slumps forward. The Chevy rolls on ina circle. INT. WAREHOUSE SOUTH PILLAR. Stevo watches as the van moves slowly around the pillar. a wide arc maybe 1000 metres. He sees Harry inside the va trying to raise his pistol. The van starts to come closer an elliptical circle. Closer and closer. Stevo can hear t music now getting louder as the van get closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry is holding on for dear life. He rests his gun on th door and fires at Stevo. He misses. The music is very lou the van.  94.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIES SONG
dialogues.text: You fill up my senses Come fill me again

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stevo sits against the pillar as the van loops near and t moves away.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIES SONG
dialogues.text: Come let me love you Let me give my life to you Let me drown in your laughter Let me die in your arms

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry is dead, the van keeps going.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIES SONG
dialogues.text: Let me lay down beside you Let me always be with you Come let me love you Come love me again

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris enters the warehouse again. He looks about. It look empty. He sees the van slowly driving around in a circle. ANNIE’S SONG

dialogues.speaker: MMMMMM MMMMMMM MMMMM
dialogues.text: He moves carefully back towards the South pillar. He has time his movements so he is not run over by the van. He s the dead eyes of Harry as it passes. The music loops nearer and then further away. As it passes Chris moves towards the pillar. INT. SOUTH PILLAR. Chris crawls over to where Stevo is. He gets behind the pillar. There is a lot of blood. He sniffs the air. Stevo dead. He takes his gun and puts it in his pocket. He look over to the AR18 cases. Nothing is moving. Chris sits there for a moment gathering his thoughts. He looks over to the upstairs windows of the offices. He can a red glow of fire.  95. Suddenly water sprinklers turn on.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Fuck it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water hits Justine’s face she comes too. She looks up and sees the water pouring over the warehouse. INT. WAREHOUSE. Harry slumps off the stearing wheel and the the Chevy cha direction. It drives towards the far wall and stops. The music still plays. Blood drips from underneath the truck, drip - drip and then stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ord looks up at the water and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: I AM BANGED UP QUITE BAD. I AM
dialogues.text: BETTING YOU AREN’T IN TOO MUCH BETTER SHAPE.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: HA. THAT’S TRUE.

dialogues.speaker: MISUNDERSTANDING..
dialogues.text: Ord slips his pistol in his belt and starts crawling over the distance John Denver is playing “It’s up to you”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris watches Ord approach. The water is still pouring. O reaches the pillar and props himself up and looks over to Chris. He looks at Stevo.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: He’s gone.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Do you know what the fight at the Harlequin was about?

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: No. I only met him a few hours ago

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Huh. Now that’s funny.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Life is ever at the mercy of idiots. He did alright though. In the end.

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: Lets get over to the van.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: You in a hurry?

dialogues.speaker: ORD
dialogues.text: I told you. I’ve got shit to do. They both smirk in a resigned way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris and Ord stand up and support each other. They hobbl towards the van. Splashing through the puddles of water t have now formed. They eventually make it to the van.  97. Chris reaches in and turns the music off. John Denver sto singing. Chris takes a breath. He looks at Ord and smiles They might get out of this yet. Suddenly a shot rings out. Ord is hit in the face, the ba of his head exploding across the van panel. He starts to slide backwards. A second shot finds Chris. Chris is hit the chest and slides down the side of the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justine watches as the two men collapse. She watches as t smoke drifts across the warehouse. The fire is taking hol now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris looks up at the water coming out of the sprinkler system. He smiles as it hits his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justine uses the pillar as leverage and manages to get to feet. She slings the rifle under her arm pit and uses it crutch. She hobbles forward. Smoke is blowing across the warehouse now. INT. WAREHOUSE BY THE VAN. Justine approaches. She sees the bodies of Ord and Chris. Chris is still alive. He looks up at Justine. He is diein

dialogues.speaker: JUSTINE
dialogues.text: I am sorry about you and your friends.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Who were the guys .. The shooters?

dialogues.speaker: JUSTINE
dialogues.text: Nobody. It was Martin’s idea. But he’s gone now. It was stupid. We were going to get out.. Justine looks sad. She looks over to his body.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: I am sorry I shot him. Justine nods. She takes the money out of Chris’s limp han

dialogues.speaker: JUSTINE
dialogues.text: I am sorry I shot you.  98. Justine puts her sunglasses on and turns to leave. Chris smiles and watches her go. He liked her. Chris talks to himself.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Death is nothing at all Death is nothing at all. I have only slipped away to the next room. I am I and you are you. Whatever we were to each other, That, we still are. Call me by my old familiar name. Speak to me in the easy way which you always used. Put no difference into your tone. Wear no forced air of solemnity or sorrow. Laugh as we always laughed at the little jokes we enjoyed together. Play, smile, think of me. Pray for me. Let my name be ever the household word that it always was. Let it be spoken without effect. Without the trace of a shadow on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justine limps forward. She holds the money. She is determ to survive.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS, (NARRATION)
dialogues.text: Life means all that it ever meant. It is the same that it ever was. There is absolute unbroken continuity. Why should I be out of mind because I am out of sight? She moves towards the shuttered door exit. Suddenly the roller comes up and she is bathed in light. She shields h eyes. Out of the light steps a fireman. Behind him a fire engine. They run in to fight the fire.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS, (NARRATION)
dialogues.text: I am but waiting for you. For an interval. Somewhere. Very near. Just around the corner. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS (NARRATION) (CONT’D) All is well. Justine stands there for a moment. She looks back towards camera. ‘This Old Guitar’ By John Denver plays
